FacilityName: Southern Ionics Incorporated Lake Charles Plant

or 127,500 lbs.  The anhydrous ammonia storage tanks are designed for 250 psig at 150 Fahrenheit.    The anhydrous ammonia storage vessel is equipped with PRVs set at 250 psig.  Since anhydrous ammonia can reach 250 psig at 111o Fahrenheit, pressure vessels are painted white and located under roof for minimizing radiant heat absorption.  

There is 1 – 30,000 gallon capacity 29.5% ammonium hydroxide pressurized storage tank.  This tank is for 125 psig at 150 Fahrenheit.  There are two 19% atmospheric storage tanks for ammonium hydroxide (20,000 and 30,000 gallons).  All ammonium hydroxide tanks are equipped with pressure relief valves, vacuum relief valves, and oxygen analyzers.     
     
The Southern Ionics Incorporated Lake Charles Plant is a manufacturer of specialty and intermediate inorganic chemicals.  The facility is located in an industrial area in Calcasieu Parish, Carlyss, Louisiana.  The facility occupies 21.8 acres and manufactures ammonium hydroxide (aqua ammonia).

c) The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps;

The facility complies with EPA’s accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM rule, and all other applicable state and local codes and regulations.

d) The five-year accident history;

In the last 5 years there was 1 incident onsite that resulted in an injury resulting from the release of aqua ammonia involving a 2 inch loading hose that failed under pressure.  There were 3 non-qualifying incidents that did not result in a release that caused death, injury, and significant damage onsite per 40 CFR Part 68.42(a).  

Qualifying event:
9/8/2020  	Employee injury eyes from aqua ammonia exposure.

Non-qualifying event:
3/18/2022 	Loading hose / vapor recovery line damaged from truck pulling off while still connected.  No spill as hoses were clear.
5/3/2023 	Employee pulled off with loading hose still connected.  Minor spill that was less than reportable quantity.
6/28/2023 	Truck tanker overfill backfilling v

RMP Executive Summary Revision – Southern Ionics – Lake Charles Facility 

Southern Ionics Incorporated owns and operates an inorganic chemicals (NAICS 325180) manufacturing plant located at 1697 Davison Road Carlyss, Louisiana.  The location is in the Calcasieu Parish.  The site occupies 21.8 acres.  The site has two non-RMP covered processes that manufacture Aluminum Sulfate and Sodium Aluminate; and one PSM / RMP covered process which manufactures ammonium hydroxide and involves the storage of anhydrous ammonia and ammonium hydroxide.  

The site has developed a risk management program to handle anhydrous ammonia and ammonium hydroxide in excess of RMP thresholds in accordance with the Risk Management Planning requirements of the Clean Air Act Amendments (CAAA) Section 112(r) mandated by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (40 CFR Part 68).    

a) The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source;

Southern Ionics Incorporated has developed an RMP program including process safety information, mechanical integrity, operational procedures, and emergency response programs for handling both anhydrous ammonia and ammonium hydroxide.  Ammonium hydroxide concentrations will range from 15-32%.  Emergency response procedures detail fire, emergency spills / releases, evacuation, medical emergencies, and notification requirements.  

b) The stationary source and regulated substances handled; 

The facility receives and stores anhydrous ammonia and converts the anhydrous ammonia into 15-32% ammonium hydroxide.  The site also stores 19.5% and 29.5% ammonium hydroxide (aqua ammonia).  Anhydrous ammonia is converted into ammonium hydroxide concentration by mixing with purified DI water.  Aqua ammonia is sold to customers and shipped from the site in truck tankers, rail cars and pipeline.  

There is 1-30,000 gallon capacity anhydrous ammonia pressurized storage tank which can hold 150,000 lbs.  This tank is limited to 85% capacity
